HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES
H.B. NO.
1345
TWENTY-SIXTH LEGISLATURE, 2011
 
STATE OF HAWAII
 
 
 
 
 
 
A BILL FOR AN ACT
 
 
RELATING TO SANITATION.
 
 
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF HAWAII:
 

     SECTION 1.  Chapter 322, Hawaii Revised Statutes, is amended by adding a new section to part I to be appropriately designated and to read as follows:
     "§322-    Definitions.  As used in this part, unless the context requires otherwise:
     "Nuisance" includes the possession of ten or more pet animals by any person, where the excrement generated by the pet animals is allowed to accumulate for over seven days without proper disposal.
     "Pet animal" means a dog, cat, domesticated rabbit, guinea pig, domesticated pig, or caged birds (passeriformes, piciformes, and psittaciformes only) so long as not bred for consumption."
     SECTION 2.  New statutory material is underscored.
     SECTION 3.  This Act shall take effect upon its approval.
 
INTRODUCED BY:
_____________________________
 

 
Report Title:
Filth; Nuisance; Pet Animals
 
Description:
Adds possession of ten or more pet animals whose excrement creates a threat to public health to the list of nuisances the Department of Health may regulate.
